snippet: President Obama said the beheading of an American journalist by militants in Syria “shocked the conscience” of the world, but vowed that America would not alter its strategy in Iraq.
abstract: Pres Obama reacts to videotaped execution of American journalist James Foley, saying entire world is 'appalled' by beheading carried out by Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; vows that United States will protect Americans everywhere.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ben Hubbard, Tim Arango and Omar al-Jawoshy from Baghdad, and Azam Ahmed from Khanke, Iraq.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said the beheading of an American journalist by militants in Syria “shocked the conscience” of the world, but vowed that America would not alter its strategy in Iraq.

headline.main: Obama, ‘Appalled’ by Beheading, Will Continue Airstrikes
headline.print_headline: The World Is Appalled by the Killing, Obama Says

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
